p.k: This video features Organ Concerto No. 5, opus 4, with the beautiful scenery of Halle in Germany. The music is played by the RIAS Sinfonietta Berlin under the baton of Kurt Redel with Edgar Krapp (organ).
p.d: George Frederic Handel composed six concertos for chamber organ and orchestra between 1735 and 1736. At that time he was living in London and wrote these pieces as interludes for the performances of his big oratorios in Covent Garden. This video features Organ Concerto No. 5, opus 4, with the beautiful scenery of Halle in Germany. The music is played by the RIAS Sinfonietta Berlin under the baton of Kurt Redel with Edgar Krapp (organ).
